metadata.Title: CVE-2023-39197 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
[netfilter: conntrack: dccp: copy entire header to stack buffer, not just basic one]

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39197` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-86-generic - 5.15.0-86.96
linux-image-5.15.0-86-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-86.96
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-86-generic - 5.15.0-86.96
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-86-generic-64k - 5.15.0-86.96
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1047-aws - 5.15.0-1047.52
No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> probably also known as ZDI-CAN-21202 commit message has a note that dccp contract support might get removed at some point in a near future (not removed as of 2023-11-10)

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.15.0-86.96').
linux-allwinner-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life').
